description: Implement the user message delegate interface and the basic output test class.
instructions: Create a new Python file at `src/ai_whisperer/user_message_delegate.py`.
In `src/ai_whisperer/user_message_delegate.py`, define an abstract base class or interface for the user message delegate.
This interface should include methods for handling different message levels (e.g., info, warning, error, debug).
Create a new Python file at `src/ai_whisperer/basic_output_test.py`.
In `src/ai_whisperer/basic_output_test.py`, implement a class that inherits from the user message delegate interface.
Implement the message handling methods in `basic_output_test.py` to print the messages to the console.
Use ANSI escape codes to color the output based on the message level (e.g., green for info, yellow for warning, red for error).
Refer to existing delegate implementations within the `src/ai_whisperer` directory (if any exist) for structural inspiration.
Ensure the implementation in `src/basic_output_test.py` adheres to the interface defined in `src/user_message_delegate.py`.
Run the tests located in `tests/test_user_message_delegate.py` to verify the implementation.
constraints: The basic output class must use ANSI escape codes for coloring.
The implementation must pass all generated tests in `tests/test_user_message_delegate.py`.
The delegate interface/abstract class should be defined in `src/ai_whisperer/user_message_delegate.py`.
The basic output test class should be defined in `src/ai_whisperer/basic_output_test.py`.
validation_criteria: `src/ai_whisperer/user_message_delegate.py` exists and defines the delegate structure (abstract class or interface).
`src/ai_whisperer/basic_output_test.py` exists and implements the delegate interface.
Running the tests in `tests/test_user_message_delegate.py` passes successfully.
The basic output class prints messages to the console with appropriate ANSI color coding based on message level.
